name: wallabag
description: Wallabag is a self-hosted read-it-later service. It saves articles from the web, cleans them up for reading, and organizes content with tags and full-text search, with mobile apps and browser integrations available.
features: Article saving: Capture web articles with a single click using browser extensions or bookmarklets for later reading.
Content extraction: Automatically strip ads, navigation, and clutter to present clean, readable article text.
Full-text search: Quickly find saved articles using powerful search across titles, content, and tags.
Tagging system: Organize articles with custom tags for easy categorization and retrieval.
Reading progress: Track reading status with archive, favorite, and unread markers to manage your reading queue.
Mobile apps: Access your reading list on iOS and Android with native apps that sync seamlessly.
RSS feeds: Generate RSS feeds from your saved articles or tags for integration with feed readers.
Annotations: Highlight text and add notes directly within articles for research or reference purposes.
Multi-user support: Create separate accounts for family members or team members with individual reading lists.
Import/export: Migrate from Pocket, Instapaper, or other services with built-in import tools and export options.
Reading time estimates: See estimated reading time for each article to plan your reading sessions effectively.
Offline access: Download articles for offline reading when traveling or in areas with poor connectivity.
